name: NSSegmentedControl.Style
desc: The following constants specify the visual style used to display the segmented control. They are used by segmentStyle.

items.name: case automatic
items.desc: The appearance of the segmented control is automatically determined based on the type of window in which the control is displayed and the position within the window.

items.name: case rounded
items.desc: The control is displayed using the rounded style.

items.name: case texturedRounded
items.desc: The control is displayed using the textured rounded style. In macOS 10.7 and later, this style uses the artwork defined for NSSegmentedControl.Style.texturedSquare, so you should specify NSSegmentedControl.Style.texturedSquare instead.

items.name: case roundRect
items.desc: The control is displayed using the round rect style.

items.name: case texturedSquare
items.desc: The control is displayed using the textured square style.

items.name: case capsule
items.desc: The control is displayed using the capsule style. In macOS 10.7 and later, this style uses the artwork defined for NSSegmentedControl.Style.texturedSquare, so you should specify NSSegmentedControl.Style.texturedSquare instead.

items.name: case smallSquare
items.desc: The control is displayed using the small square style.

items.name: case separated
items.desc: The segments in the control are displayed very close to each other but not touching. For example, Safari in macOS 10.10 and later uses this style for the previous and next page segmented control.
